page.title: 13THORPE-LE-SOKEN CARNIVAL
page.content: EACH YEAR THE VILLAGE HAS A CARNIVAL IN THE MIDDLE OF JUNE. PEOPLE DRESS UP AND STAND ON THE BACK OF A DECORATED TRUCK CALLED A FLOAT, AND ALL THE FLOATS GO IN PROCESSION THROUGH THE HIGH STREET FROM FIRST GREEN TO TENDRING HIGH SCHOOL. PRIZES ARE GIVEN FOR THE MOST HUMOROUS AND THE PRETTIEST FLOAT. THERE IS A CARNIVAL QUEEN AND TWO PRINCESSES CHOSEN FROM AMONG THE GIRLS OF THE VILLAGE AND THEIR FLOAT IS DECORATED WITH FLOWERS. QUEENS FROM OTHER AREAS JOIN THE PROCESSION. THIS YEAR THE THEME FOR THE CARNIVAL WAS EUROPE AND AMONG THE FLOATS WERE ONES REPRESENTING FRANCE, HOLLAND AND ITALY. ROLPH SCHOOL WON FIRST PRIZE FOR THEIR FLOAT ABOUT THE BRITISH SEASIDE. AFTER THE PROCESSION THERE IS A FETE WITH PROCEEDS BEING SHARED BETWEEN ALL THE VILLAGE ORGANISATIONS TAKING PART.
